english: Pending the time she would finally pack and go, everybody should be content with eating just anything.
yoruba: Títí di ìgbà tí ó máa fi kó ẹrù rẹ̀ lọ pátápátá, kí oníkálùkù ní ìtẹ́lọ̀rùn pẹ̀lú ohunkóhun tó bá rí jẹ.

english: She knew how best she was going to take care of herself and Tinu.
yoruba: Ó mọ bí ó ṣe má a tọ́jú ara rẹ̀ àti Tinú.

english: Alamu Should learn to look after himself.
yoruba: Kí Àlàmú kọ́ bí ó ṣe máa tọ́jú ara rẹ̀.

english: His old Mama should not come back again and be given the chance to snap and make any further wicked insinuations.
yoruba: Kí ìyá rẹ̀ má tún padà wá láti máa jágbe kí ó sì pòwe ìkà kankan.

english: Now it was going to be everybody for himself,  God for us all.
yoruba: Báyìí, ó ti di kí olórí dorí ẹ̀ mú, kí oníkálùkù wà fún ra ara rẹ̀, Ọlọ́run wà fún gbogbo wa.

english: Labake assumed a "na him sabi" posture and found herself suddenly in high spirits, she sang in high pitch, her voice rang like a bell.
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ ń ṣe ìṣe "òun ló mọ̀" ọkàn rẹ̀ déédé gbé sókè láti kọ orin rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ohùn òkè, ohùn rẹ̀ dún bí i agogo.

english: Her countenance was gay.
yoruba: Ìrísí rẹ̀ fi inú dídùn rẹ̀ hàn.

english: She told herself she had no problem.
yoruba: Ó sọ fún ara rẹ̀ pé òun kò ní ìṣòro kankan.

english: Nothing to worry about.
yoruba: Kò ní nǹkankan láti dààmú fún.

english: No woman on earth in the whole wide world was ever as happy as she was.
yoruba: Kò sí obìnrin náà lórí ilẹ̀ ní gbogbo ayé tí inú rẹ̀ dún tó bí inú rẹ̀ ṣe dùn.

english: Why should she not be happy?
yoruba: Kí ló ṣe tí inú rẹ̀ kò ní dún?

english: Her days were numbered in Alamu's house.
yoruba: Ọjọ́ rẹ̀ ti níye nínú ilé Àlàmú.

english: The days of sorrow and tribulations were numbered.
yoruba: Ọjọ́ ìbànújẹ́ àti wàhálà rẹ̀ ti níye.

english: The divorce suit was well on the way, she'd almost finished packing her things.
yoruba: Ẹjọ́ ìkọ̀sílẹ̀ ti wà lọ́nà, òun náà ti fẹ́rẹ̀ ẹ́ palẹ̀mọ́ àwọn nǹkan rẹ̀ tán.

english: Tinu gave her no problem, the little girl was full of life and spirit, she herself had been blessed with good health.
yoruba: Tinú ò sì fún un ní wàhálà kankan, ọmọbìnrin kékeré náà kúnfún ìyè, ẹ̀mí àlàáfìà tó péye ni Ọlọ́run fi jíǹkí òun fún ara rẹ̀.

english: In spite of the difficult period at home she'd maintained her pretty look, her elegant posture.
yoruba: Ládúrú ìnira tó wà nílẹ̀ ó sì rẹ̀wà síbẹ̀, ìdúró rẹ̀ dún síbẹ̀.

english: Nobody seeing her would ever think she was a woman with problems.
yoruba: Kò sí ẹni tó má ri tá sọ pé obìnrin tó ní ìṣòro ni.

english: With her present girlish shape and figure, she could go back to England and re-enter the glamorous world of fashion.
yoruba: Pẹ̀lú ìrísí omidan tí ó ní lọ́wọ́ lọ́wọ́ yìí, ó lè padà sí England kí ó sì tún padà sí àyè oge síse ẹ̀.

english: She would need only three or four months tuning up and reconditioning her body, then catch up finally.
yoruba: Á kàn nílò láti tún ara rẹ̀ ṣe fún bí oṣù mẹ́ta sí mẹ́rin, á padà sípò.

english: So no regrets, she sang hilariously, she clapped her hands, she danced.
yoruba: Fún ìdí èyí, kò sí àbámọ̀, ó rẹ́rìn-ín tàríyá-tàríyá, ó palẹ̀mọ̀, ó jó.

english: Her soprano voice was throated, and trembling, she wiggle her hips the imaginary rhythm of the brass and the wind instruments, she took measured steps forward backward and jumped up excitedly telling herself again and again that she was a happy woman, happy…  h-a-p-p-y! happy... very happy.
yoruba: Ohùn òkè rẹ̀ tínrín, ó sì ń gbọ̀n rìrì, ó jùdí sí ìlú àti orin inú afẹ́fẹ́ tí ó ń rò lọ́kàn, ó ka ìwọ̀n ẹsẹ̀ díẹ̀ síwájú-sẹ́yìn ó ń fò sókè tìdùnnú-tìdùnnú, ó tún sọ fún ara rẹ̀ léraléra pé obìnrin tí ó láyọ̀ ni òun, ó láyọ̀... l-á-y-ọ̀! láyọ̀... láyọ̀ gidi gan.

english: Labake straightened her back and threw out her chest, arms swung freely, her feet marked time left, right, left right, she was sweating!
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ na ẹ̀yìn, ó sì ti àyà sí wájú, ó jupá láìsídìíwọ́, ó ń gbé ẹsẹ̀ sósì sọ́tùn-ún, sọ́tùn-ún sósì, ó ń làágùn!

english: But wait... what really was happening?
yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n dúró ná ó ... kí gan-an ló ń sẹlẹ̀?

english: Labake stopped briefly to ask herself.
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ dúró díẹ̀ láti bi ara rẹ̀ ní èyí.

english: She held her breath minute, pondering.
yoruba: Ó sé èémí fún ìṣẹ́jú kan, ó ń wòye.

english: Why all this show of excitement and intoxication?
yoruba: Kíni ìdí fún gbogbo àfihàn ìdùnnú àti ìyírí yìí?

english: Was she going mad? Was she going crazy too?
yoruba: Ṣe òun ti ń ya wèrè? Ṣe òun náà ti ń ya wèrè ni?

english: "No, No", she answered herself... No.
yoruba: "Rárá, Rárá o", ó dá ará rẹ̀ lóhùn ... Rárá.

english: It was Alamu going mad, it was Alamu who had infact, gone mad.
yoruba: Àlàmú ló ń sínwín, kódà, Àlàmú ló tí ya wèrè.

english: Not her ... Not her!
yoruba: Kìí ṣe òun ...kì í ṣe òun!

english: Before God and man!
yoruba: Níwájú Ọlọ́run àti ènìyàn!

english: Labake stretched forward her two arms and danced, more enthusiastically, to that imaginary rhythm of music.
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ ná ọwọ́ rẹ̀ méjéèjì síwájú, ó sì jó pẹ̀lú ìtara sí ìlú àfinúrò orin náà.

english: No more problem for her.
yoruba: Kò sí ìṣòro fún  un mọ́.

english: She was happy, quite happy. She breezed into the sitting room with her clumsy dancing footsteps, her strange, intricate movement of the hips, slowly towards the standing mirror where she became even more excited
yoruba: Inú rẹ̀ dùn, ó dùn dáadáa. Ó bẹ́ wọ inú yàrá ìgbafẹ́ pẹ̀lú ìgbésẹ̀ ijó rẹ̀ tó lọ́pọ̀, ìsọwọ́jùdí rẹ̀ sàjèjì, ó ń rìn súnmọ́ jígí adádúró díẹ̀díẹ̀ níbi tí inú rẹ̀ ti tún bọ̀ dùn sí i.

english: She threw up her two hands into empty air and twisted her body round and round and round several times - until she became dizzy.
yoruba: Ó ju ọwọ́ rẹ̀ méjéèjì sínú afẹ́fẹ́ ó sì yípoyípo láìmọye ìgbà títí tí òyì fi kọ́ ọ.

english: Then she slumped into the nearby chair, breathing heavily, perspiring profusely.
yoruba: Ó sì ṣubú sínú àga tí ó wà nítòsí, ó ń mí lókèlókè.

english: Then the whole building started a momentary journey into space with her as its solitary astronaut...
yoruba: Lẹ́yìn èyí ni gbogbo ilé bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìrìnàjò àjò pàtàkì sínú òfurufú pẹ̀lú rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí adáwakọ̀ òfurufú ...

english: Why? Why all these? She asked herself again. What's happening? Wasn't she really running out of her mind too?
yoruba: Kíni ìdí? Kíni ìdífún gbogbo èyí? Ó tún ara rẹ̀ bi. Kí ló ń sẹlẹ̀? Se orí tirẹ̀ náà o ti máa yí báyìí?

english: Zenabu heaved a heavy sigh from behind the pantry door where she stood watching her madam.
yoruba: Sènábù mí kanlẹ̀ láti ẹ̀yìn ìlèkùn ilé ìkóunjẹpamọ́ sí níbi tí ó ti ń dúró wòran màdáámù rẹ̀.

english: She had heard madam's strange songs and now she's seen her dance a strange, off-beat dance.
yoruba: Ó ti gbọ́ àwọn orin àjèjì màdáámù, ó sì tún ti rí ijó abàmì rẹ̀ tí ò bálù mu.

english: As she tried to get back inside the pantry to avoid her attention, she knocked her head against the wall and tripped over the plates she'd just brought inside the pantry.
yoruba: Bí ó ṣe wá ń gbìyànjú àti padà sínú ilé oúnjẹ láti má jẹ́ ki wọ́n rí i, ó sẹrí mọ́ ògiri, ó sì ṣísẹ̀ sórí àwọn abọ́ tí ó sẹ̀sẹ̀ kó wọ ilé oúnjẹ náà.

english: There was something about madam now that was always pushing Zenabu away from her.
yoruba: Nǹkankan máa ń wà nípa màdáámù báyìí tí ó ń lé Sènábù lára rẹ̀ ni gbogbo ìgbà.

english: Each time she saw her something always told her to run away, or hide.
yoruba: Nígbàkúgbà tí ó ba rí i, nǹkankan máa ń sọ fún un pé kí ó sá lọ, tàbí kí ó sá pamọ́.

english: Madam had been so aggressive in recent times.
yoruba: Màdáámù ti ń kanra ganan lẹ́nu ọjọ́ mẹ́ta yìí.

english: It did not appear that she liked her anymore - the way she now looked and talked to her.
yoruba: Kò fẹ́ jọ pé ó fẹ́ràn rẹ̀ mọ́ ìsọwọ́ wò ó àti bí ó se ń ba sọ̀rọ̀.

english: Each time madam showed up in the sitting room, therefore, Zenabu would find her way into the toilet to answer nature's call!
yoruba: Nígbàkúgbà tí Màdáámù bá farahàn ní yàrá ìgbafẹ́, kíá ni Sènábù máa ń wábi gbà wọ ilé ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀ láti lọ sẹ̀yọ́!

english: But, it did not seem as if that trick would work anymore.
yoruba: Sùgbọ́n kò fẹ́ jọ pé ọgbọ́n yẹn máa ṣiṣẹ́ mọ́.

english: Because only yesterday, madam cried out: Zenabu! Zenabu! Where is this mischievous little creature?
yoruba: Nítorí àná alánàá ni màdáámù ṣì kígbe pé: Sènábù! Sènábù! Ibo ni èké kékeré yì wà?

english: Here madam! Here madam! Zenabu had answered.
yoruba: Níbí Màdáámù! Níbí Màdáámù! Sènábù dáhùn.

english: ‘Inside the toilet as usual? What the hell is wrong with this little wretch?
yoruba: Nílé ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀, bí ó ṣe ń ṣe? Kí ni ó ń bá olòṣì kékeré yìí jà ná?

english: Always in the toilet 'Nothing madam! Here I am madam!" Zenabu had stood before her, looking at her pleadingly.
yoruba: Gbogbo ìgbà ní ilé ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀ “kò sí nǹkankan Màdààmú, èmi rè é màdààmú” Sènábù dúró níwájú rẹ̀, ó ń wò pẹ̀lú ojú ẹ̀bẹ̀.

english: Madam's smart fingers caught Zenabis little ears, and as she uttered some obscenities shook her violently, pushing her hither and thither.
yoruba: Ọwọ́ màdààmú ti yára gbá etí Sènábù kékeré mú ó sì sọ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ ìríra sí i, ó gbò ó jìgìjìgì síbí sóhùn-ún.

english: You will soon go away!' she shouted, "your job here is almost done, you don't seem to know.
yoruba: Ó pariwo, “Wà á tó lọ, isẹ́ ẹ ti fẹ́rẹ̀ ẹ́ tán, ó dàbí i pé o ò mọ̀.

english: Soon you'll be returned to your people.
yoruba: Láìpé, wọn á dá ẹ padà fún àwọn ènìyàn rẹ̀.

english: Give me just two or three days.
yoruba: Fúnmi lọ́jọ́ méjì sí mẹ́ta.

english: Labake let go her hands and Zenabu's body hit the floor with a thump!
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ tú ọwọ́ rẹ̀, Sènábù sì subú, gbà!.

english: There was nobody near to tell all these to.
yoruba: Kò sẹ́nikẹ́ni nítòsí láti sọ gbogbo èyí fún.

english: Zenabu, very much, longed for somebody to relate her experience to - a trusted person, one who would understand and pity her.
yoruba: Ó wu Sènábù púpọ̀ láti rẹ́ni sọ ìrírí rẹ̀ fún - ẹni tó ṣe é fọkàn tán, ẹni tí yóò yé, tí yóò sì káàánú ẹ̀.

english: Imagine her joy when at last, old Mama again knocking at the door of the house.
yoruba: Ẹ wòye bí ayọ̀ rẹ̀ ṣe kún tó nígbẹ̀yìn gbẹ́yín tí màmá àgbà tún kan ìlẹ̀kùn ilé yẹn.

english: And her all alone in the house too!
yoruba: Tí ó tún bá òun nìkan nílé!

english: Mama had barely taken her seat when Zenabu's tongue started to wag like the restless tail of a dog on seeing its owner.
yoruba: Màmá ò tíì jóòkó tàìjókòó ti ahọ́n Sènábù bẹ̀rẹ̀ si í gbòn bí i ti ìrù ajá tí ó ń mì tí ó bá rí olówó rẹ̀.

english: Madam has gone mad! Zenabu announced to old Mama.
yoruba: Màdáámù ti ya wèrè! Sènábù kéde fún màmá àgbà.

english: Gone thoroughly mad! It is a great looks wild like the bush cat.
yoruba: Wọ́n ti ya wèrè gan-an! Ó ti jọ ehànnà, bí ológbò-igbó.

english: Her rough bushy hair has dropped carelessly over her neck, stretching to her shoulders making her look like a devil.
yoruba: Irun rẹ̀ tí ó ki bí i igbó yẹn ti dà wálẹ̀ sí èjìká rẹ̀, èyí sì ń jẹ́ kí jọ èṣù.

english: Her finger nails are now very long and sharp, like the beak of the kingfisher.
yoruba: Èékánná rẹ̀ ti wá gùn gan-an ó sì mú, à fi bí ti ẹnu ẹyẹ.

english: There was not a day madam would not deep her long nails inside her cheeks and pull her by the ears.
yoruba: Ọjọ́ kan ò lè kọjá kí màdáaḿù má ti èékánná yẹn bọ̀ ọ́ lẹ́rẹ̀kẹ́ kí ò sì fà á létí.

english: She showed her blistered ears and swollen cheeks to Mama.
yoruba: Ó fi etí àti ẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ rẹ̀ wíwú han màmá.

english: Madam would one day tear her to pieces, at the rate she was going, with those long, sharp nails of hers or with those snaggy iron teeth because she had become mad.
yoruba: Màdáámù á sì yá á sí wẹ́wẹ́ níjọ́ kan pẹ̀lú bí ó ṣe ń lọ yìí, pẹ̀lú èékánná gígùn rẹ̀ tí ó mú yẹn tàbí eyín irin rẹ̀ yẹn nítorí ó tí ya wèrè.

english: Very mad, Zenabu confessed she was fed up, and would like to go back to her people at home.
yoruba: Wèrè gidi, Sènábù jẹ́wọ́ pé ó ti sú òun, á sì wù òun láti padà sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn rẹ̀ nílé.

english: Listening to Zenabu relate her story gave Mama great joy.
yoruba: Màmá láyọ̀ ńlá bí ó ṣe ń tẹ́tí sí bí Sènábù ṣe ń sọ ìtàn rè.

english: She patted the little girl on the back and told her not to worry.
yoruba: Ó fi ọwọ́ lu ọmọ náà jẹ́jẹ́ lẹ́yìn, ó sì sọ fún  un pé kí ó má ṣe dààmú.

english: All would be well at last...
yoruba: Ohun gbogbo á dára níkeyìn ...

english: It was good Labake was running mad.
yoruba: Ó dára bí Làbákẹ́ ṣe ń yí lórí.

english: It was expected.
yoruba: Ohun tí wọn ń retí ni.

english: Mama was not surprised.
yoruba: Èyí kò sì jẹ́ ìyàlẹ́nu fún màmá.

english: Esuniyi had told her Labake would have a bitter taste of her own medicine before long.
yoruba: Èṣùníyì ti sọ fún un pé Làbákẹ́ á jẹ nínú ẹ̀fọ́ ìkà tí ó ti rò kí ó tó pẹ́.

english: And now, it has started to happen, greater things were soon going to happen.
yoruba: Ní báyìí, ó tí wá ń sẹlẹ̀, nǹkan tí ó ju èyí á tó máa sẹlẹ̀.

english: Mama was in town to collect some of Labake's hair and her fingernails.
yoruba: Irun-orí àti èékánná Làbákẹ́ ni màmá wá gbà ní ìgboro.

english: Esuniyi needed them for further action so that Labake's final doom might be sealed.
yoruba: Èṣùníyì fẹ́ lò ó láti fi túnbọ̀ ba ti Làbákẹ́ jẹ́.

english: It should not surprise anybody, therefore, to see Labake - probably next week or week after - run out to the streets and pitch her home in the market square under the full glare of people who had come to buy and sell.
yoruba: Kò ní láti ya ẹnikẹ́ni lẹ́nu lẹ́yìn èyí láti rí Làbákẹ́ lẹ́yìn ọ̀sẹ̀ kan tàbí méjì ní àwọn òpópónà kí ó sì dúró sí gbàgede ọjà níbi tí àwọn ènìyàn tí wọn wá ṣe kárà-kátà á tí rí ìran pípé wò.

english: Esuniyi had said it and Mama knew that was exactly what would happen.
yoruba: Èṣùníyì ti sọ ọ́, màmá sì mọ́ pé bí ó ṣe máa sẹlẹ̀ gan-an nìyẹn.

english: Finally, Labake would crawl on her knees, in penitence to Esuniyi's lunatic asylum.
yoruba: Nígbẹ̀yìn gbẹ́yín,  Làbákẹ́ á fí orúnkún rẹ̀ ráwọ ọgbà Èsúńiyì pẹ̀lụ́ ìronúpíwàdà.

english: In the case of Alamu, Esuniyi had told Mama there was no cause for alarm anymore.
yoruba: Ní ti Àlàmú, Èṣùníyì ti sọ fún màmá pé kò séwu lóko mọ́.

english: Alamu's condition would start improving henceforth.
yoruba: Ipò tí Àlàmú wà á máa yàtọ̀ sí dáadáa láti ìsínyì lọ.

english: Mama was happy, all what Esuniyi told her had started to come to pass.
yoruba: Inú màmá dùn, gbogbo nǹkan ti Èṣùníyì sọ fún ló ti ń wá sí ì músẹ.

english: Alamu returned home and met his mother with a gay countenance.
yoruba: Àlàmú padà délé, ó sì bá ìyá rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìrísí tó fi inú dídùn hàn.

english: He greeted the old woman smiling prostrating.
yoruba: Ó kí ìyá náà pẹ́lù ẹ̀rín músẹ́ lẹ́nu ní ìdọ́bálè.

english: He was returning from an important mission to town, the outcome of which greatly cheered his spirit.
yoruba: Ó ń ti ibi isẹ́ kan pàtàkì nígboro bọ̀, èyí ti àyọrísí rẹ̀ mú un dárayá.

english: For the first time in nine months, Alamu heaved a sigh of relief.
yoruba: Fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ nínú oṣù mẹ́sàn-án, Àlàmú mí ìmí ìtura.

english: For nine whole months, he had surrounded himself with a mystery that had continued to baffle everybody; a secret that had proved impossible for anybody to decipher - except for that one man who was so dear to him - Adio his only friend.
yoruba: Fún odidi oṣù mẹ́sàn-án gbáko ní ó ti yí ara rẹ̀ ká pẹ̀lú àdììtú kan tí ó rú gbogbo ènìyàn lójú; àsírí kan tí kò ṣe é ṣe fún ẹnikẹ́ni láti tú – yàtọ̀ sí ọkùnrin kan tí ó súnmọ́ ọn pẹ́kípẹ́kí - Àdìó ọ̀rẹ́ rẹ̀ kanṣoṣo.

english: Now the end of that mystery was in sight.
yoruba: Níbáyìí, òpin àdììtú yẹn ti wà nítòsí.

english: The end of his mental and physical agony was in view, the end of his madness was at hand.
yoruba: Òpin sí dàrúdápò ọpọlọ àti ìrora rẹ̀ ti súnmo itòsí.

english: He had been told to wait for only two more weeks when all his problems would be practically solved.
yoruba: Wọn tí sọ fún un pé kí ó dúró fún  ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sí i tí gbogbo ìṣòrorẹ̀ á fi yanjú pátápátá.

english: Alamu couldn't believe his ears.
yoruba: Àlàmú kò gbà etí rẹ̀ gbọ́.

english: Eagerly, he counted the days one, two, five, ten, fifteen...
yoruba: Pẹ̀lú ìwànwara ní ó fi ń ka àwọn ọjọ́, ení, èjì, ẹ̀ta, ẹ̀rin, àrún, ẹ̀wá, mẹ́ẹ̀dógún ...

english: Fifteen more days! He counted the hours! The minutes!
yoruba: Ọjọ́ mẹ́ẹ̀dógún sí i! Ó ń ka wákàtí! ìsẹ́jú!

english: Adio was amused at Alamu's show of thrill and excitement.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ìyàlenu fún Àdìó bí Àlàmú ṣe ń ṣe àfihàn ìrusókè ìdùnnú rẹ̀.

english: Well, two weeks more they say and judgment would be delivered?
yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀, ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sì ni wọ́n sọ, ìdájọ́ á sì wáyé?

english: That was too short a time compared with the nine months that he'd been waiting.
yoruba: Ìyẹn kéré púpọ̀ níye sí oṣù mẹ́sàn-án tí ó ti fi ń dúró.

english: Was he going to cry or was he going to smile after a fortnight?
yoruba: Ṣé yóò sunkún ni, tàbí yóò rẹ́rìn-ín músẹ́ lẹ́yìn ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì?

english: He'd been told he would smile.
yoruba: Wọn tisọ fún  un pé á rẹ́rìn-ín músẹ́.

english: Everything pointed to the fact that he would smile.
yoruba: Gbogbo nǹkan ló sì tọ́ka sí i dájúdájú pé yóò rẹ́rìn –ín músẹ́.

english: So, it was just proper that he should start smiling from now on, in hope and optimism.
yoruba: Fún ìdí èyí, ó tó kí ó kúkú bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí i rẹ́rìn- ín músẹ́ láti ìsìnyí nínú ìrètí áti ìgbàgbọ́ pé gbogbo nǹkan a sìse fún rere.

english: That was why he now met his old mother with a dazzling natural smile...
yoruba: Ìdí nìyí tí ó fi fi ẹ̀rín músẹ́ tó rí yan-ran yan-ran kọ mọ̀nà pàdé ìyá rẹ̀...

english: Mama watched her son, and her heart sang for joy.
yoruba: Màmá ń wo ọmọ rẹ̀, ọkàn rẹ̀ sì kọrin fáyọ̀.

english: Here was her son now smiling at her and responding normally to questions and discussions.
yoruba: Ọmọ rẹ̀ wa rè é tó ń rẹ́rìn-ín músẹ́ sí i tí ó sì ń fèsì bí ó ṣetọ́ sí ìbéèrè àti àsọgbà ọ̀rọ̀ wọn.

english: What was more, Alamu politically took permission from his mother that he had other things doing in town again. He would, therefore, be going back but would not be long.
yoruba: Kílótún kù, Àlàmú fi tọ̀wọ̀tọ̀wọ̀ tọrọ ìyọ̀ǹda lọ́wọ́ ìyá rẹ̀ pé òun ṣì tún ní àwọn nǹkan mìíràn láti ṣe ní ìgboro. Fún ìdí èyí ó fẹ́ padà jáde ṣùgbọ́n kò níí pẹ́.

english: Her son now had the courtesy to take permission! The first part of the job had been accomplished! God bless Esuniyi.
yoruba: Ọmọ rẹ̀ ti wá ńi ìbuyì fún un, láti gbà ààyè! Apá kìíní iṣ́e náà ti parí! Á dáa fún Èṣùníyì.

english: Mama waited patiently for Labake to return.
yoruba: Màmá dúró pẹ̀lú sùúrù pé kí Làbákẹ́ dé.

english: And when she saw her approaching from a distance, she quickly rummaged through the basket she brought from the district and took out a small bottle inside which she kept the herbalist's concoction.
yoruba: Nígbà tí ó sì rí i tí ó ń bọ̀ lọ́ọ̀ọ́kán, ó tètè tú apẹ̀rẹ̀ tí ó gbé wá láti ìgbèríko, ó sì mú ìgò kékeré tí ó tọ́jú òògùn babaláwo rẹ̀ sí.

english: She'd been properly briefed by Esunivi on how she would apply it.
yoruba: Èṣùníyì ti sọ bí ó ṣe máa lò ó fún un.

english: So, now, she staggered towards the doorstep of Labake's room and sprinkled the concoction, in a straight line.
yoruba: Nísìnyí, ó ta gbọ̀n-ọ́n gbọ̀n-ọ́n sẹ́nu ọ̀nà yàrá Làbáké, ó sì wọn òògùn náà sílẹ̀ sórí ìlà tẹ́ẹ́rẹ́ kan.

english: It was important that Labake should walk across it as she entered her so that she might be more violently possessed both mind and body.
yoruba: Ó se pàtàkì kí Làbákẹ́ dá a kọjá bí ó bá ti ń wọ yàrá rẹ̀ kí tiẹ̀ lè túbọ̀ bá a ní tọkàn-tarà.

english: After sprinkling the preparation, Mama turned round and round five times according to the herbalist's instructions.
yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí ó bá ti wọn òògùn náà tán, Màmá yípo yípo lẹ́ẹ̀marùn-ún gẹ́gẹ́bí babaláwo rẹ̀ ṣe la kalẹ̀.

english: But as she was starting on the fourth round, Labake entered, watching the old woman, mouth agape.
yoruba: Bí ó ṣe wà lórí ẹ̀ẹ̀kẹ́rin, Làbákẹ́ wọlé, ó ń wo ìyá àgbà náà, pẹ̀lú ẹnu rẹ̀ ní lílà sílẹ̀.

english: Mama stood for a while, nodded in reply to Labake's greetings and then leaned against the wall facing Labake's room, muttering to herself, several times, the short incantatory sentence she'd been asked to recite on first seeing Labake.
yoruba: Màmá dúró fún ìgbà díẹ̀, kanrí mọ́lẹ̀ ní èsì kíkí Làbákẹ́ ó sì fẹ̀yìntì ògiri tí ó kọjú sí ògiri yàrá Làbákẹ́, ó ń sọ àwọn ìpèdé tí wọn ní kó pè tí ó bá ti fojú gán-án-ni Làbákẹ́ sí ara rẹ̀ láìmoye ìgbà.

english: At the end of it all, Mama laughed.
yoruba: Ní òpin gbogbo rẹ̀, màmá bú sẹ́rìn-ín.

english: Labake's appearance was indeed wild, it was even more terrible than Zenabu had described it.
yoruba: Ìrísí Làbákẹ́ jọ ti ẹhànnà gidi, ó tiẹ̀ tún banilẹ́rù ju bí Sènábù ti ṣàpèjúwe rẹ̀.

english: Labake had really gone mad now - the way she looked like some dreadful monster from inside an old cave poised for rampage!
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ ti wá ya wèrè gidi báyìí – bí ó ṣe rí, ó dàbí i ewèlè tí ó wá láti inú ihò àpáta tí ó ti ṣetán ìjà!

english: Her bushy hair dangled over her neck and shoulders and hid part of her face.
yoruba: Irun rẹ̀ tí ó dàbí i igbó dà wálẹ̀ sọ́rùn àti èjìká rẹ̀, ó sì bo apá ibìkan lójú rẹ̀.

english: The hair... yes, that was one of the items she'd come for.
yoruba: Irun yẹn ... bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, ọ̀kan lára àwọn nǹkan ti ìyá wá wá rè é.

english: Before leaving for the district later in the day, she had to ensure that a sizeable lock of that hair was cut and kept away inside her basket.
yoruba: Kí ó tó máa lọ sí ìgbéríko ní ìrọ̀lẹ́, ó gbọ́dò rí i pé ó rí èyí tó tó wọ̀n nínú irun náà gé kí ó sì tọ́jú rẹ̀ sínú apẹ̀rẹ̀ rẹ̀.

english: Then, Labake's long finger nails, her red, long nails.
yoruba: Lẹ́yìn náà ní èékáná gígùn ọwọ́ Làbákẹ́, èékán gígùn pupa rè.

english: That was one other item she'd come to fetch.
yoruba: Ìyen tún ní nǹkan tí ó wá mú.

english: Mama's eyes roamed from Labake's black hair to her red nails for some time.
yoruba: Ojú màmá ń wo láti irun orí Làbákẹ́ dúdú dé èékaná pupa rẹ̀ fún ìgbà díẹ̀.

english: Finally she looked Labake straight in the face and said;
yoruba: Nígbẹ̀yìn, ó wo Làbákẹ́ tààrà ó sì ní;

english: "Hem... Hem... Hem!" she cleared her throat, "Hem... You. You are still here?"
yoruba: "Ẹm Ẹm Ẹm!", ó kọ́kọ́ tún ọ̀nà òfun rẹ̀ ṣe. "Ẹm.…Ìwọ. Ìwọ sì wá níbí?"

english: Labake ignored her and walked towards her room. "What else are you staying here for?"
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ fi ojú paárẹ́ ó sì rìn lọ sí ọ̀nà yàrá rẹ̀. “Kí lo tún ń dúró ńbí fún?”

english: "Me?", Labake asked.
yoruba: "Ṣé èmi?", Làbákẹ́ bèèrè.

english: She entered her room crossing Mama's border! Falling into Mama's laid down trap! The herbalist's trap!
yoruba: Ó wọ yàrá rẹ̀ lọ ní dídá ibòdè màmá kọjá! Ó kó sínú páńpẹ́ màmá! Páńpẹ́ babaláwo!

english: And in a minute, she rushed out of her room again and confronted Mama, wearing a murderous look. "I am now listening!"
yoruba: Ní ìṣẹ́jú kan, ó kù gìrì jáde láti inú yàrá rẹ̀, ó dójúkọ màmá pẹ̀lú ìwò tí ó lè pànìyàn lójú rẹ̀. "Mo ti ń gbọ́ báyìí!"

english: "She glared. What are you saying, old woman? "
yoruba: Ó wo o. "Kí ni ó ń sọ, ìyá àgbà?"

english: "Asking you... "
yoruba: "Mò ń bi ẹ..."

english: "Asking me what, old woman!"
yoruba: "Bi mí ní kí ni, ìyá àgbà?"

english: "Whether you are ..."
yoruba: "Bóyá o ò ..."

english: "Whether you are what, old woman!"
yoruba: "Bóyá o ò se kí ni, ìyá àgbà!"

english: "Not yet gone ..."
yoruba: "Tí ì lọ ..."

english: "Gone where, old woman! ", Labake had moved closer to Mama now, pointing her long red finger nails threateningly.
yoruba: "Lọ ibo, ìyá àgbà!", Làbákẹ́ ti súnmọ́ màmá báyìí, tí ó sì ń na èékáná pupa gígùn rẹ̀ tìhàlè-tìhàlè.

english: "You want to beat me?"
yoruba: "Ṣe o fẹ́ nà mí ni?"

english: Look old woman! My palms are itching to slap the face of an old witch!
yoruba: Wò ó ìyá! Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ń yún mi, ó ń ṣe mí bí kí n gbá ojú àjẹ́ àgbà kan!

english: See my fingernails moving and moving, anxious now to pluck out the eyes of the hag from their sockets.
yoruba: Ṣé o rí bí ìka ọwọ́ mi ṣe ń sún yìí, ó ń sé wọn bí i kí wọ́n fa ẹyin ojú àjẹ́ méjéèjì yọ láti inú àkò.

english: "Me! Me, Labake?"
yoruba: "Èmi! Èmi, Làbákẹ́?"

english: I feel a tingling sensation inside my mouth! I want to test the sharpness of my teeth!
yoruba: "Mo ń ní àìbalè nínú ẹnu mi! Mo fẹ dánbí ẹyín ẹnu mi ṣe mú tó wò!

english: Dipping them inside the wrinkled pallor of an old hag!
yoruba: Nípa rírì wọ́n bọ inú àwọ̀ híhunjo àgbàyà kan"

english: "Who? It is you old hag! You that is mad!  "
yoruba: "Tani? Ìwọ àgbàyà yìí ni! Ìwọ lo ya wèrè!"

english: "Me? mad? "
yoruba: "Èmi? wèrè?"

english: "Yes, mad! You turned round and round like one in the grip of an epileptic fit.
yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, wèrè! Ó wò yípo yípo bí i ẹni tí gìrì wárápá gbé.

english: You leaned against the wall like a tired old dog!
yoruba: Ó lẹ̀ mọ́ ògiri bí ajá gbígbó tó rẹ̀.

english: You whispered like the nanny goat chewing the cud! Mad! Mad! I Say Mad! What else are you but a mad woman!
yoruba: Ó ń sọ̀rọ̀ kẹ́lẹ́ kẹ́lẹ́ bí ewúrẹ́ alágbàtó tí ó ń jẹ́ àpọje lẹ́nu! Wèrè! Wèrè! Wèrè ni mo sọ! Kí tún ni ẹ bí kò ṣe wèrè lobìnrin!

english: Labake stood breathing heavily on Mama.
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ dúró, ó ń mí lókèlókè lé màmá.

english: A sentence more from Mama even a word more, and Labake would have hauled herself on the old woman and sent her grave before the appointed time.
yoruba: Bí màmá bá sọ gbólóhùn kan sí i, bó bá sọ ẹyọ ọ̀rọ̀ kan,  Làbákẹ́ ò bá ti bò ìyá àgbà  náà, á sì rán an lọ sí sàréè láìtó ọjọ́.

english: Mama smiled, and tactfully withdrew.
yoruba: Màmá rẹ́rìn-ín músẹ́, ó sì fi ọgbọ́n ẹ̀wẹ́ jáwọ́.

english: She was not annoyed, not annoyed at all.
yoruba: Kò bínú, kò bínú rárá.

english: Labake was already under a spell.
yoruba: Òògùn ló ń sisẹ́ lára Làbákẹ́.

english: Labake had literally dug her own grave now that she had crossed the concoction line across the doorstep of her own room.
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ ti gbẹ́ kòtò ara rẹ̀ nísìnyí tí ó ti dá ìlà òògùn kọjá lẹnú ọ̀nà yàrá rẹ̀.

english: What remained for her to do was to literally put Labake inside the prepared coffin, nail the coffin, and bury it inside the deep earth.
yoruba: Ohun tí ó kàn kù fún un ní kí ó gbé Làbákẹ́ sínú pósí, kí ó kàn án pa, kí ó sì sín-in sínú ilẹ̀ tí ó gbẹ́.

english: Mama withdrew and allowed Labake to continue raving and raging.
yoruba: Màmá yọwó, ó sì gbà  Làbákẹ́ láàyè láti tẹ̀síwájú láti máa sọ̀rọ̀ fitafita pẹ̀lú ìrunú.

english: Mind your own business henceforth, old hag! Stop poking your wrinkled nose! You have outlived your usefulness.
yoruba: Láti ìsínyì lọ, sọ́gbá ẹ àgbàyà! Yé é na imú híhunjo rẹ̀ yẹn! Ó tí gbélé ayé kọjá ìwúlò rẹ̀.

english: Leave me old witch! Leave me alone! Go back to the district to say your last prayers on earth.
yoruba: Fi mí sílẹ̀ àjẹ́ àgbàyà! Fi mí lọ́rùn sílẹ̀! Padà lọ sí ìgbéríko láti lọ ṣe àdúrà ìkẹyìn rẹ̀ lórí ilẹ̀ eèpè.

english: Your time is up already and your grave is ready.
yoruba: Àsìkò rẹ̀ tíẹ titó, sáré  rẹ̀ sí tì wà nílẹ̀.

english: Never come to town again.
yoruba: Má wà sí ìgboro mọ́ láé.

english: You hear that hag!
yoruba: Ṣóogbọ́ bẹ́ yẹn àjẹ́!

english: Mama did not utter a word in reply, rather she was smiling, she knew what was happening.
yoruba: Màmá ò fèsì ọ̀rọ̀ kan, kàkà bẹ́ẹ̀ ń ṣe ló ń rẹ́rìn-ín músẹ́, ó mọ̀ ohun tó ń sẹlẹ̀.

english: Labake was mad now.
yoruba: Làbákẹ́ ti ya wèrè báyìí.

english: Thoroughly mad. Just as Esuniyi had said, so she would not give a single reply, very soon, Labake would pack to her new home in the market square. So, let the tirade continue: Go on!
yoruba: Wèrè sán-ún sán-ún. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Èṣùníyì ṣe sọ fún, ìdí èyí kò ní èsì kankan, láìpẹ́, Làbákẹ́ á kẹ́rù lọ sí ilé rẹ̀ tuntun ní gbàgede ọjà. Fún ìdí èyí, kí idán ìbínú sọ̀rọ̀ náà tẹ̀síwájú: Tẹ̀síwájú!

english: Yes, go on! Are you tired?
yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, kò tẹ̀síwájú! Ṣe ó ti rẹ̀ é ní?

english: You couldn't be tired yet! Let the tirade continue by all means!
yoruba: Kò tí ì yẹ kí ó rẹ̀ ẹ́! Ó gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ kí ó tẹ̀síwájú lọ́nàkonà!

english: After some five minutes, there was quiet Mama winked at Zenabu; silently and knowingly, the little girl nodded her head back.
yoruba: Ìdákẹ́rọ́rọ́ wà lẹ́yìn ìsẹ́jú márùn-ún, màmá sẹ́jú sí Sènábù; kẹ́lẹ́kẹ́lẹ́ náà ní ọmọbìnrin kékeré náà kanrí mọ́lẹ̀ padà.

english: She had grown so much used to Mama now that communication between them had become quite easy.
yoruba: Ó ti mọwọ́ màmá tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ti wá rọrùn láàrin wọn.

english: Labake, after working herself up, setting her own body ablaze went inside the bathroom to have a cold shower and swiftly, Zenabu moved into action.
yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí ó ti dá ara rẹ̀ láàmú, tí ó ti gbé ẹ̀mí ara rẹ̀ gbóná Làbákẹ́ gbọ̀nà balùwẹ̀ lọ láti sanra pẹ̀lú omi tútù, ní kíá sì ni Sènábù bẹ̀rẹ̀ isẹ́

english: She was not a stranger to madam’s bedroom, she knew all the nooks and corners of things included in the room.
yoruba: Kì í ṣe àjèjì sí yàrá màdáámù, gbogbo ibi kọ́lọ́fín àti ikòrògún yàrá náà ni ó mọ̀.

english: She knew where madam kept all her most private of all her possessions.
yoruba: Ó mọ gbogbo ibi tí màdáámù ń tọ́jú àwọn nǹkan ẹ̀ sí títí mọ́ àwọn nǹkan àṣírí rẹ̀.

english: And now that madam had neatly packed, it was all the more easy for Zenabu to locate the two items she was looking for. Under three minutes, she had finished the assignment and she came out of madam's room clutching the two items, neatly wrapped up inside an old paper, and smiling at Mama.
yoruba: Nìsínyí tí màdáámù ti fẹ́rẹ̀ ẹ́ kó ẹrù rẹ̀ tán, ó rọrùn fún un láti rí àwọn nǹkan méjì tí ó wà. Láàrin ìsẹ́jú mẹ́ta, ó tí parí isẹ́ tí wọn gbé fún un ó sì jáde láti inú yàrá màdáámù, tí ó sì di nǹkan méjéèjì mọ́wọ́, ó fi bébà àtijọ́ kan wé e, tí ó sì rí tónítóní, ó sì ń rẹ́rìn-ín músẹ́ sí màmá.

english: Mama got the piece of paper and quickly tucked it away inside her basket.
yoruba: Màmá gbà á ó sì tètè fi sínú apẹ̀rẹ̀ rẹ̀.

english: When finally Labake emerged from inside the bathroom, what she saw was little Zenabu playing with Tinu on the corridor, and Mama bidding  Alamu who had just come in goodbye promising to check back on him before the end of that week.
yoruba: Nígbà ti màdáámù jáde láti inú balùwè, ohun tí ó rí nípé Sènábù kékeré ń bá Tinú seré lẹ́nu ọ̀nà, màmá sì ń dágbére fún Àlàmú tó sẹ̀sẹ̀ ń wọlé dé, tí wọn sí ń ṣe ìlérí láti wá wò ó kí ó to di òpin ọ̀ṣẹ̀ náà.

english: The two items were secure inside her basket.
yoruba: Àwọn nǹkan méjì náà wà ní ìpamó nínú apẹ̀rẹ̀ rẹ̀.

english: Mama had stolen a look at the two items herself, and had been very much pleased: four of Labake's long red nails which she pointed at her a short while ago and which she had removed as she Chtered the room.
yoruba: Màmá ti jí àwọn nǹkan náà wò nínú apẹ̀rẹ̀ rẹ̀, ó sì tẹ ẹ lọ́rùn; mẹ́rin nínú èékánná pupa ọwọ́ Làbákẹ́ tí ó fi nawọ sí i láìpẹ́ yìí, tí ó yọ nígbà tí ó wọ yàrá.

english: Her false nails! Then Labakes Small lock of hair, which some minutes ago had boen dangling over her body and which she had removed as she prepared to go to the bathroom, her wig!
yoruba: Èékán-ná ayédèrú! Àti díẹ̀ nínú irun Làbákẹ́ tí ò dà wálẹ̀ sára rẹ̀ láìpẹ́ yìí tí ó yọ nígbà tí ó fẹ́ wọ balùwẹ̀, ayédèrú irun rẹ̀!

english: These two items now for Esubiyi!
yoruba: Àwọn nǹkan méjì yìí ti wà nílẹ̀ fún Èṣùníyì.

english: The time was near, when Labake would run of the house into the streets naked: when she would pitch her home at the market square, when she would crawl on her knees to Esuniyi's camp in the isolated area of the forest in the district!

english: You just don't worry.
yoruba: Ìwọ ṣáà má ṣèyọnu.

english: "I have tried my best to save the situation and Esubiyi has been assisting us so much.
yoruba: "Mo ti sa gbogbo ipá mi láti wá ojútùú sí i, Èṣùníyì sì ti ń ràn wá lọ́wọ́ gidi.

yoruba: Èyí ló fà á tí o fi wà láàyè lónìí, ìdí níyì tó ò ṣe tí ì já sí ìgboro – ìwọ lè má mọ̀.

english: On your behalf. I have made sacrifices to the gods with billy goats, alligator pepper, bitter kola and red palm-oil.

english: Mama knew Alamu would be shocked to hear all these but, could she be bothered?
yoruba: Màmá mọ̀ pé gbogbo èyí á já Àlàmú  láyà bí ó bá gbọ́, sùgbọ́n ṣé ó yẹ kí ìyẹn tún da òun fún rarẹ̀ láàmú?

english: No, she would not even raise her head up to look at her son's face.
yoruba: Rárá, kò ní wulẹ̀ gbé orí sókè láti wojú ọmọ rẹ̀.

english: "Now, get prepared Alamu", she would finally tell him, we are going together now to see Esuniyi.
yoruba: "Àlàmú  gbaradì", á pàpà sọ fún un "A jọ ń lọ rí Èṣùníyì nísìnyí".

english: "Me? What for?" She could imagine her son questioning back, protesting.
yoruba: "Èmi? Fún kí ni?", Ó ń rò ó bí ọmọ rẹ̀ ṣe ń dáhùn ìbéèrè padà, tí ó ń tẹnumọ pé.

english: "Not me! Not me!".
yoruba: "Èmi kọ́! Èmi kọ́!"

english: "It's you Alamu!", she resolved she would shout back, 'It's you, You, you and me! We'll go together now, to the herbalist.
yoruba: "Ìwọ ni Àlàmú !", ó pinnu láti pariwo mọ́ ọn padà, Ìwọ ni, Ìwọ, Ìwọ àti èmi! A jọ ń lọ nísìnyí ni, sọ́dọ̀ oníṣègùn.

english: You will drink from his medicine pot. Take your bath inside the open pool in the centre of his camp and be incised on the body.
yoruba: Wà á mu láti inú ìkòkò àgbo rẹ̀. Wà á wẹ̀ nínú ibú omi tí ó wà ní ààrin ibùdó rẹ̀, wọn á sì sín gbẹ́rẹ́ sí ọ́ lára.

english: Alamu would probably Laugh at her and walk away, or take to his heels even.
yoruba: Àfàìmọ̀ kí Àlàmú má fi ṣe yẹ̀yẹ́ tàbí kí ó kàn kúrò níwájú rẹ̀, tàbí kí ó tilẹ̀ ki eré mọ́lẹ̀.

english: She would pursue him herself.
yoruba: Màmá fúnrarẹ̀ á lé e mú.

english: Mama imagined herself chasing Alamu down the stony crooked forest path.
yoruba: Màmá wóye ara rẹ̀ bí ó ṣe ń lé Àlàmú lọ sọ́nà igbó olókùúta náà.

english: Chasing him to the bank of river Akokura, appealing to him to come back. begging him, before he would cross that river.
yoruba: Tí ó ń lé e lọ sọ́nà etí odò Akókurà, tí ó bẹ̀ẹ́ pé kí ó padà, tí ó ń bẹ́ẹ̀ kí ó tó di wí pé ó kọjá odò náà.

english: Before he would cross the Rubicon.
yoruba: Kí ó tó di wí pé ó kọjá ibi tí kò ti ní lè padà.

english: Once he crossed river Akokura, there will be no further hope.
yoruba: Bí ó bá filè kọjá odò Akókurà, kò ní í sí ìrètí kankan fún un mọ́.

english: He should not cross any river - or else... She imagined her son still hurrying away.
yoruba: Kò gbọdọ̀ kọjá odò kankan, bí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́... Ó ń wòye bí ọmọ rẹ̀ ṣe ń kánjú lọ.

english: The mighty power of the enemies was upon him, pushing him, pushing him, making him resist all attempt to bring sanity back. She could hear Alamu snapping back at her.
yoruba: Ọwọ́ agbára ńlá àwọn ọ̀tá wà lára rẹ̀, ó ń tí í, tì í, ó ń jẹ́ kí ó máa kọ gbogbo ìgbìyànjú láti mú kí orí-rẹ̀ pé. Ó ń gbọ́ bi Àlàmú ṣe ń jágbe mọ́ ọn.

english: Go back to the village Mama! Go and rest in the village! I would go back to town.
yoruba: Màmá, ẹ padà sábúlé! Ẹ lọ sinmi lábúlé! Èmi á padà sí ìgboro.

english: Nothing is wrong with me! I have business to do in town, so, I am hurrying away!
yoruba: Nǹkan ò ṣe mí! Mo ní iṣẹ́ tí mo fẹ́ ṣe ní ìgboro, mo tètè ń lọ!

english: Mama imagined herself launching a grip, a firm grip on him, a 'kill-me-now, kill-me-now' grip.
yoruba: Màmá tún wòye ara rẹ̀ bí ó ṣe gbá a mú, ó gba mú gírí-gírí, ìgbámú 'pamí-nísìnyí, pamí nísìnyí'.

english: Esuniyi laughed, Mama sat straight, waking up suddenly from her momentary dream.
yoruba: Èṣùníyì rẹ́rìn-ín, Màmá jókòó sára, ó déédé tají lójú àlá àsìkò tí ó ń lá.

english: Esuniyi had all along been watching her reading her mind.
yoruba: Èṣùníyì tí ń wò ó látẹ̀ẹ̀kan ti ó ń ka nǹkan tí ó ń lọ lọ́kàn rẹ̀.

english: It was as if he had seen the picture of what went on inside it.
yoruba: Ń ṣe ni ó dàbí i pé ó ti rí àwòrán nǹkan tí ó ń lọ níbẹ̀.

english: "Your son will not refuse coming to the district Mama". Esunyi said, I'll go with you to bring him.
yoruba: Màmá, ọmọ yín ò ní kọ̀ láti wá sí abúlé'. Èṣùníyì sọ, Màá tẹ̀lé yín lọ láti mú un wá.

english: He will gladly follow us.
yoruba: Tayọ̀tayọ̀ ló máa fi tẹ̀lé wa.

english: Don't worry Mama, I'll just pop into their house for a minute or two.
yoruba: Ẹ má da ara yín láàḿu màmá, màá kàn yọ fóró sínú ilé wọn fún bí ìsẹ́jú kan sí méjì.

english: Our eyes would be four, and that's all. I'll rush back to the district and he'll follow later,  probably that same day or the following day.

english: Mama heaved a heavy sigh again, she had implicit confidence in the powers of the medicine man.
yoruba: Màmá tún mí kanlẹ̀, ó ní ìgbẹkẹ̀lé tó dúró gírí nínú agbára bàbá olóògùn.

english: With this man, Esuniyi, nothing seemed impossible.
yoruba: Pẹ̀lú ọkùnrin yìí, Èṣùníyì, ó fẹ́rẹ̀ ẹ́ lè má sí nǹkan tí ò ṣeéṣe.

english: So, she left for the village with a feeling of relief.
yoruba: Fún ìdí èyí, ó gbọ̀nà abúlé lọ, pẹ̀lú ìtura lọ́kàn rẹ̀.

english: There was one vacant room inside Mama's mud building in the village where Alamu could put up, if need be, when finally they succeeded in bringing to the district.
yoruba: Yàrá òfìfo wà nínú ilé alámọ̀ Màmá níbi tí Àlàmú  lè dúró sí, bí ó bá nílò, lẹ́yìn tí ó bá ti jàjà ṣàṣeyọ́rí nínú mímú un wá si abúlé.

english: He did not have to return In the same day.
yoruba: Kò nílò láti padà sí ìgboro ní ọjọ́  náà.

english: Esuniyi might want him to stay over.
yoruba: Èṣùníyì lè fẹ́ kí ó sùn mọ́jú.

english: In that case, Alamu could come to the village and stay the night.
yoruba: Fún ìdí ìyẹn, Àlàmú lè wá sí Abúlé kí ó sì sùn mọ́jú ọjọ́ kejì.

english: Mama set about putting the vacant room in good order instantly, she brushed down the cobwebs and chased away the geckos and cockroaches.
yoruba: Màmá bẹ̀rẹ̀ sì í tún yàrá náà ṣe lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀, ó gbọn gbogbo jàǹkárìwọ̀ sílẹ̀, ó sì lé àwọn ááyán àti ọmọ-onílé lọ.

english: She sprinkled water on the floor and started sweeping it, she sneezed for the umpteenth time, her head rang like a bell.
yoruba: Ó wọ́n omi sílẹ̀, ó sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ si í gba a, ó ń sín láìmoye ìgbà, orí rẹ̀ ń ró bí agogo.

english: She blew her nose, water came from her eyes and she went deaf for a minute.
yoruba: Ó fún imú rẹ̀, omi jáde lójú rẹ̀, etí rẹ̀ di fún ìsẹ́jú kan.

english: Later when she yawned, the doors of her ears flung open and the trapped air rushed out of them, again she sneezed.
yoruba: Nígbà tó yá ti ó yán, ìlèkùn inú eti rẹ̀ ṣí gbayawu, atẹ́gùn tó ti há síbẹ̀ sá jadé ó tún sín.

english: Life was all suffering.
yoruba: Ìjìyà gbá à ní ayé jẹ́.

english: That was even more so with Mama.
yoruba: Bí ó ṣe rí fún màmá gan-an rè é.

english: She'd suffered, probably like no other woman had ever suffered before.
yoruba: Ó ti jìyà, irú ìyà ti obìnrin kankan ò jẹ rí.

english: Four times in her life, she lost her pregnancy. Two before Alamu and two after him.
yoruba: Ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹ́rin ní ayé rẹ̀ ni oyún ti bàjẹ́ mọ́ ọn lára. Méjì kí ó tó bí Àlàmú àti méjì mìíràn lẹ́yìn Àlàmú.

english: Then she couldn't become pregnant again, then she reached menopause.
yoruba: Lẹ́yìn náà kò lè lóyún mọ́, ó wọ iye ọjọ́ orí tí kò ti lè ṣabiyamọ mọ́.

english: Alamu remained her only child.
yoruba: Àlàmú  nìkan lọmọ kan ṣoṣo tí ó ṣẹ́kù fún un.

english: When about ten years ago, her son went to the white man's country, Mama felt she had lost the battle to cure permanent happiness in life.
yoruba: Níbí i ọdún mẹ́wàá sẹ́yìn, tí ọmọ rẹ̀ lọ sí ìlú Òyìnbó, Màmá rò wí pé ogun wíwá ayọ̀ ayérayé ti borí rẹ̀.

english: It was as if Alamu had gone on a jourmey of no return.
yoruba: Ń ṣe ní ó dàbí ẹni pé Àlàmú  ti rìn ìrìnàjò àrèmabọ̀.

english: Mama was virtually left alone in the world.
yoruba: Màmá nìkan ló dàbí ẹni pé ó kù láyé.

yoruba: Bàbá Àlàmú tí ì bá ṣe alátìlẹ́yìn àti olùfọ kàntán ti dùbúlẹ̀ àìsàn tí ò sí jẹ orúkọ ọmọ rẹ̀ lẹ́nu títí ó fi ku, èyí gbo màmá dé ọpọlọ àti ìmọ̀lára lẹ́yìn ìgbà  náà.

english: It was true they often read Alamu's letters to her hearing, letting her know Alamu was alive.
yoruba: Òótọ́ ni pé wọn máa ń ka lẹ́tà Àlàmú sí eti ìgbọ́ rẹ̀, láti fi jẹ́ kí ó mọ̀ pé Àlàmú ṣì wà láàyè.

english: Still Mama would not believe.
yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, Màmá ò gbàgbọ́.

english: She would close her eyes and listen to the soothing words contained in Alamu's letter. He was hale and hearty, doing well in his studies, he was there in the cold land struggling to secure a better future for himself and Mama, very soon he would be coming back home to join her.
yoruba: Á dijú rẹ̀, á sì tẹ́tí sí àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ ìtura tó wà nínú lẹ́tà Àlàmú. Ara rẹ̀ á yá, ó sì mókun, ó sì ń ṣe dáadáa nínú ẹ̀kọ́ rẹ̀, ó wà níbẹ̀ nínú òtútù, ó ń tiraka láti wá ọjọ́ iwájú fún ara rẹ̀ àti Màmá, láìpẹ́ á máa padà bọ̀ nílé láti wá dara pọ̀ mọ́ ọn.

english: Mama should take heart, stay alive and continue to pray for him.
yoruba: Kí Màmá mọ́kàn, kí ó wà láàyè kí ó si tẹ̀síwájú láti máa gbàdúrà fún un.

english: "Your ever loving son - Alamu".
yoruba: "Ọmọ yín onífẹ̀ẹ́ òótọ́ – Àlàmú "

english: Mama would open her eyes and muse to herself in disbelief.
yoruba: Màmá á lajú rẹ̀, á sì ṣàṣàrò sí ara rẹ̀ ni àìgbàgbọ́.

english: Could all these be true really?

english: Or the trick of some good people who did not want her inside the grave too soon.

english: Those who did not want her to die of loneliness, who then had to console her with letters allegedly written by her son.
yoruba: Àwọn tí kò fẹ kí ó ku ikú àdágbé, tí wọn sì ní láti tù ú lọ́kàn pẹ̀lú lẹ́tà tí wọn ní ọmọ rẹ́ kọ.

english: The son she knew, deep down in her heart had gone on a journey of no return.

english: Lost forever, after waiting eight years in vain for Alamu's return, there was no other conclusion Mama could draw.
yoruba: Ó ti sọnù títí láé, lẹ́yìn tí ó tí dúró ìdúró asán fún ọdún mẹ́jọ fún ìpàdabọ̀ Àlàmú, kò sí ìpinnu mìíràn tí màmá lè ní.

english: And that explained why the old woman gazed at her son in wonder and incredulity the day he finally arrived back in the country from England.

english: That explained why, for a whole week after, Mama kept asking herself whether the healthy looking Vivacious young man was really Alamu or his ghost.

english: And she called him by all his names - all the affectionate names he gave him during childhood, several times each day for one whole week.

english: It was the climax of her joy, such joyous period would came back again to Mama. Life was one long chain of suffering. No end to it.

english: It was a continuous event.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó ń tẹ̀síwájú.

english: But precisely two years after Alamu's retum, a heartache of a different dimension took possession of Mama.

english: A heartache which gave her several sleepless nights, which made her have several dreadful dreams, which made her breasts twitch several times, and which now made her a regular visitor to the herbalist's asylum.

english: All for love of the child.
yoruba: Gbogbo èyí, fún ìfẹ́ ọmọ.

english: It was not possible to fathom the depth of a mother's suffering over the child.
yoruba: Kò ṣeé ṣe láti mọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ ìyà ìyá lórí ọmọ.

english: That's one reason the mother is the true owner of the child.
yoruba: Èyí ni ìdí kan pàtàkì tó fi jẹ́ pé ìyá ní ó lọmọ lóòótọ́.

english: Mama made a desperate resolution, next time she set her eyes on Labake, the story was going to be different.

english: She would be downright violent with her, knock her head against Labake's chest, tear at her.
yoruba: Á gbé e gbóná fún un, á sẹ orí rẹ̀ mọ́ Làbákẹ́ láyà, á ya á jẹ.

english: She would not wait for that slow vengeance of the herbalist anymore.
yoruba: Kòní í dúró de ẹ̀san díẹ̀díẹ̀ ti babaláwo yẹn mọ́.

english: The day she met Labake again, perdition would come down quick and fast on her.

english: Leave Alamu alone! she would shout on the enemies' agent, holding her by the throat, leave my son alone! My only son.

english: My garment, leave my only garment alone to enjoy his life Pack and go!

english: Pack your load and go now!' It is going to be an order.
yoruba: "Kó ẹrù rẹ̀ kí ó lọ nísìnyí! Á jẹ́ àṣẹ.

english: No dialogue anymore with the enemy at home.
yoruba: Kò sí ìtàkùrọsọ pẹ̀lú ọ̀tá tí ó wà nílé mọ.

english: She would not give her chance to snap at her like she did the other day, calling her old woman, hag, witch...
yoruba: Kò ní fún un láyè láti dá gbọn un bí ó ṣe ṣe níjọ́sí, tí ó ń pè é ni ìyá àgbà, àgbàyà, àjẹ́...

english: Pack your load and go now! Let's see your back Labake. Never dare look back!
